title: Knife Skills: How To Slice An Apple For Pies
subtitles: having regularly sized slices is essential for an apple pie or tart to cook evenly the easiest way to do this is to start by holding the Apple on its flower end slice directly down one side coming as close to the core as possible without actually getting to any of the core place the Apple flat on the cut surface then cut off the remaining three sides rotating the Apple is necessary then discard the core holding one piece cut side down with your free hand carefully cut it into slices using the knuckles of your free hand as a guide repeat this with all the Apple pieces and cook immediately to avoid discolorationhaving regularly sized slices is essential for an apple pie or tart to cook evenly the easiest way to do this is to start by holding the Apple on its flower end slice directly down one side coming as close to the core as possible without actually getting to any of the core place the Apple flat on the cut surface then cut off the remaining three sides rotating the Apple is necessary then discard the core holding one piece cut side down with your free hand carefully cut it into slices using the knuckles of your free hand as a guide repeat this with all the Apple pieces and cook immediately to avoid discoloration

title: How to Eat Ice Cream
description:
Learn how to eat ice cream with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-Ice-Cream

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: there are lots of delicious ways to eat ice cream like in an ice cream cone or in a bowl with your favorite toppings nuts candy fruit and whipped cream are all great choices if you like cookies make your own ice cream sandwich by putting a scoop of ice cream in between two cookies or try topping a slice of pie brownie or cake with a scoop of ice cream if you're looking for a treat you can enjoy on the go make a milkshake by mixing equal parts milk and ice cream in a blenderthere are lots of delicious ways to eat ice cream like in an ice cream cone or in a bowl with your favorite toppings nuts candy fruit and whipped cream are all great choices if you like cookies make your own ice cream sandwich by putting a scoop of ice cream in between two cookies or try topping a slice of pie brownie or cake with a scoop of ice cream if you're looking for a treat you can enjoy on the go make a milkshake by mixing equal parts milk and ice cream in a blender

title: How to Feed a Wild Rabbit
description:
Learn how to feed a wild rabbit with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Feed-a-Wild-Rabbit

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to feed a wild rabbit in your yard choose a wooded or shrubby area where a rabbit will feel safe and scatter plenty of grass and hay there you can supplement the grass and hay with a small amount of pelleted rabbit food from a pet store but avoid feeding the wild rabbits too much since pellets are very nutritionally dense you can also give them leafy greens like lettuce spinach and swiss chardto feed a wild rabbit in your yard choose a wooded or shrubby area where a rabbit will feel safe and scatter plenty of grass and hay there you can supplement the grass and hay with a small amount of pelleted rabbit food from a pet store but avoid feeding the wild rabbits too much since pellets are very nutritionally dense you can also give them leafy greens like lettuce spinach and swiss chard

title: How to Freeze Blueberries
description:
Learn how to freeze blueberries with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Blueberries

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if you have extra blueberries and you want to freeze them spread the berries in a single layer on a cookie sheet place the pan into the freezer for two to three hours or until the blueberries are frozen then remove the tray so the berries don't become freezer burned place the frozen berries into a resealable plastic bag then remove all of the air and seal it use a marker or sticker to label the blueberries with the date you froze them and enjoy them for up to a yearif you have extra blueberries and you want to freeze them spread the berries in a single layer on a cookie sheet place the pan into the freezer for two to three hours or until the blueberries are frozen then remove the tray so the berries don't become freezer burned place the frozen berries into a resealable plastic bag then remove all of the air and seal it use a marker or sticker to label the blueberries with the date you froze them and enjoy them for up to a year

title: How to Freeze Butternut Squash
description:
Learn how to freeze butternut squash with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Butternut-Squash

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to freeze butternut squash raw first peel the squash and cut it into cubes remove the seeds and pulp as you cube the squash line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spread out the butternut squash in a single layer so the pieces aren't touching each other freeze the squash for several hours then transfer to a sealed container and return to the freezerto freeze butternut squash raw first peel the squash and cut it into cubes remove the seeds and pulp as you cube the squash line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spread out the butternut squash in a single layer so the pieces aren't touching each other freeze the squash for several hours then transfer to a sealed container and return to the freezer

description:
Learn how to husk corn with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Husk-Corn

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow

subtitles: to husk corn by hand pull away the outer leaves until there is only one layer of leaves remaining on the ear then pull back the last layer of leaves to expose the tip of the corn and gather them all in one hand to pull them to the bottom of the ear once you can see the kernels gather all of the silky toss for remaining of the corn and pull them down the corn in one movement remove the leaves and the tassels by firmly grasping them at the bottom of the ear and breaking them away from the cobto husk corn by hand pull away the outer leaves until there is only one layer of leaves remaining on the ear then pull back the last layer of leaves to expose the tip of the corn and gather them all in one hand to pull them to the bottom of the ear once you can see the kernels gather all of the silky toss for remaining of the corn and pull them down the corn in one movement remove the leaves and the tassels by firmly grasping them at the bottom of the ear and breaking them away from the cob

title: How to Make Caramel Apples
description:
Learn how to make caramel apples with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Caramel-Apples

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to make caramel apples start by washing and de-stemming the apples then insert wooden sticks into the stem holes and place the apples in the fridge next melt the caramel candies in a saucepan over low heat when the caramel is thin enough to drip off a spoon remove the apples from the fridge and dip each one into the sauce place the apples on a parchment lined baking sheet after dipping and refrigerate for one to two hours before serving for helpful tips like how to coat your apples evenly with the caramel sauce read onto make caramel apples start by washing and de-stemming the apples then insert wooden sticks into the stem holes and place the apples in the fridge next melt the caramel candies in a saucepan over low heat when the caramel is thin enough to drip off a spoon remove the apples from the fridge and dip each one into the sauce place the apples on a parchment lined baking sheet after dipping and refrigerate for one to two hours before serving for helpful tips like how to coat your apples evenly with the caramel sauce read on
